= Class *jplex.components.MenuBar*  _extends [APIPangolincommonComponent jplex.common.Component]_  =

== Description ==
MenuBar component<br />Place a nice menu bar on your page. It's designed as <br />the classical menu bars in applications.<br />It is possible to link events on terminal items. <br />As an additional feature, you could specify a key shortcut<br />for this event.<br />The source for the menu items could be either:<br /><ul><br /><li>a raw JS array. The definition of an item looks like:<br /><pre>{ <br />name:"Item",<br />click: clickHandler, //Reference to the function to be called at click<br />icon: 'path/to/icon.png', // Path to a 16x16 icon which will be displayed on the left (optional)<br />keySC: {<br />code: Event.Key.Y, // Key code of the shortcut<br />ctrl: true, // The shortcut requires the modifier Ctrl to be pressed<br />text: "Ctrl+Y" // Text displayed at right of the item<br />},<br />items: [{...},{...},...] // Array of subitems<br />}</pre></li><br /><li>XML document, fetched with Ajax.Request, with the following scheme:<br /><xmp><br /><menubar><br /><item name="Item" icon="path/to/icon.png"><br /><click key="Event.Key.Y" ctrl="true" text="Ctrl+Y"><br /><![CDATA[function() { ... }]]><br /></click><br /><items><br /><item>...</item><br />...<br /></items><br /></item><br /></menubar></xmp></li><br /><li>JSON document, fetched with Ajax.Request <br />(exactly similar to the syntax of the JS Array)</li><br /></ul><br />Notice that this class is a singleton. Therefore it can't be instantiated twice.


== Event Table ==
|| *Name* || *Description* || *Parameters* ||
|| _afterRenderEvent_ ||  Event that fires after the rendering of the menu ||  ||
|| _beforeRenderEvent_ ||  Event that fires before the rendering of the menu ||  ||
|| _onClickEvent_ ||  Event that fires when the menu is clicked ||   - `event <Event>`  the DOM Event information <br/>  ||
|| _onItemAddEvent_ ||  Event that fires when an item is added to the menu
When an item is added, the handler is copied to the event of the same name of its submenu. ||   - `item <MenuBar.Item>`  the added item <br/>  ||

== Methods ==                                
|| *Signature* || *Return Type* || *Description* ||
|| `addItem(oItem, nBefore)` || `MenuBar` || Adds the item oItem to the menu root.<br/>If specified, adds it before the nBefore'th item<br />  - `oItem <Object>` Item to add (please refer to the doc above for item properties) - `nBefore <Integer>` Optional. Position of the item (by default the item is pushed at the end)||
|| `getInstance()` || `MenuBar` || Get the instance of the menu bar<br /> ||
|| `getItem(nIndex)` || `MenuBar.Submenu` || Get the submenu of the item at position nIndex<br />  - `nIndex <Integer>` Position of the item to get||
|| `hide()` || `void` || Hides every opened item of the menu<br /> ||
|| `removeItem(nIndex)` || `void` || Removes the item at position nIndex<br />  - `nIndex <nIndex>` Optional. Position of the item||
|| `render()` || `void` || Renders the menu bar root<br /> ||
